Menino to endorse Warren

Boston Mayor Thomas M. Menino is expected to endorse Elizabeth Warren tomorrow according to two people with knowledge of the plan. (Globe, 10:17 a.m.)
  • Brown, Warren tasks clear for debate tonight
  • Bucking trend, new poll puts Brown ahead of Warren
More on Mass. race for Senate

Parents: Saugus school didn't call for ambulance when daughter broke arm

The fourth-grader's mother said the school nurse called her about her daughter's severely broken arm, but failed to call an ambulance. (AP, 9:04 a.m.)
  • Discuss Share your thoughts on this article

Suspected 'Bearded Bandit' under arrest

Police said the man believed to be behind a series of bank robberies including one involving a fake beard, was arrested at a Seekonk motel. (Globe, 9:51 a.m.)

Mass. jobless rate rises to 6.3 percent

The August Massachusetts unemployment rate was up from 6.1 percent in July, as the state’s economy lost 4,800 jobs, according to the state. (Globe, 9:16 a.m.)

In the app era, radio goes Wi-Fi and 3G

Remember when listening to radio meant tuning a dial? These days, smartphone apps can pull in your favorite hometown sports and news via Wi-Fi or 3G. (Boston Globe)

Boston is the undisputed center of the nerdverse — offering a plethora of options for dweebs, techies, trekkers, weirdos, and gamers. (Boston Globe)

45 to lose jobs at Children's Hospital

In all, the Harvard-affiliated hospital is eliminating 255 jobs and open positions, about 2.6 percent of its 9,600 jobs, according to a memo. (Boston Globe)

29 dead, 46 injured in Mexico pipeline fire near US border

The death toll in a pipeline fire at a distribution plant near the US border has risen to 29, Mexico's state-owned oil company said Wednesday. At least 46 others were injured.

Has US economy bottomed out? Census suggests yes

The U.S. economy is showing signs of bottoming out: Americans are on the move again after record numbers had stayed put, and more young adults are leaving their parents’ homes.
